history.text: Hello, how are you today?
is anybody there>
Hi, I'm good. You should check out this movie, "Home Alone."
Yes, I watched it many times when I was a kid!
How about you. did you see it?
Me too. It has a Rotten Tomatoes score of 62%, but I liked it.
Yes, it was one of the best family movies back in the 80"s so cute and innocent!
They don't make them like that today!
Mccalay Kulkin was really good back then-before he went crazy!:-)
It was actually made in 1990, can you believe that?
I know, seems so recent, time goes by so fast...
I liked Joe Pesci in it too
yes, he was really good, the whole cast did a great job
I like the Christmas/holiday theme
also makes me very nostalgic about the good old days...everything was stable...the real America!
I liked all the different booby-traps
those were funny-especially when one of them fell out of the window!
I like the emotional aspects too-how he got reunited with his mom and the sad elderly man...so touching
Chris Columbus did a good job with directing it
My kids liked it even today, although to them it seems like an ancient thing:-)!
They were in such a rush because of the temporary power outage that reset the alarm clocks. That would never happen today :)
No way, we are too technologically advanced! I remember VCRs were big during that time and shown in the movie and my kids asked me what  it was!
lol, that's funny! Do you like comedy movies?
Smart comedy-because today there is too much dumb comedy! But old classic 80's and 90's comedy is the best!
Like John Candy
how about you?
Yeah, I do.  Home Alone had a lot of slapstick comedy, which I normally don't care too much for, but I liked it in that movie.
exactly, good family movie!
Heartbreak kid was a good old classic comedy
The instructions said they would give us 3 movies to talk about, but so far, it's just Home Alone, so sorry to drag it out. Do you like John Heard, he plays the dad?
No problem at all, we need to do this properly-yeah John Heard was pretty good, and I liked the mom, can't recall the actress's name
she was in a ,lot of 80's moviesx
It's Catherine O'Hara
Yes, that's it!:-)
the nerdy cousins with glasses were pretty funny and the bully brother as far as characters go
It's funny that Kevin's family never finds out what exactly he was up to when they were gone.
the house remains in perfect shape!
he is an inventive kid!
For sure!
I would watch it again, would you?
Totally! They made a new version but it is not the same at all!
It looks like we are finished here-thanks for chatting with me, have a great day!
Nothing like a classic 1990 movie. Bye, thanks! :)

uid1response.feedback: Thanks so much for the chat-the other user was very nice and responsive!
